result.execSummary:
The defendant Elise K Brophy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight time.
CORRECTED 11/2/2015:  COURT ORDERS 4 MONTHS JAIL SENTENCE.  DEFENDANT TO REAMIN IN CUSTODY UNTIL JUNE 15, 2015.  AT THAT TIME THE REMAINDER OF THE SENTENCE IS STAYED AND DEFENDANT TO BE RELEASED TO DAY REPORT CENTER FOR COMPLIANCE FOR 60 DAYS.

AMENDED 11/10/2015:  COURT REVOKES DAY REPORTING, DEFENDANT TO FINISH THE SENTENCE.  COURT ORDER THE DEFENDANT TO SERVE THE REMAINING 120 DAYS JAIL SENTENCE, WITHOUT WORK RELEASE, WITH 59 DAYS CREDIT.  JAIL TERM MAY BE SERVED IN A STATE INSTITUTION.
Consecutive to: 14CM1247 and Concurrent with 14CF0935

Court costs waived.
DNA Surcharge waived.
DNA Sample waived.

records.addlTxt: dated 12/29/2015, filed by WCS. (reviewed by Judge Ramirez on 01-04-16)

Defendant Elise K Brophy in court, in custody, with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties make statements.  Court revokes day reporting, defendant to finish the sentence.  Court orders the defendant to serve the remaining 120 days jail sentence, without work release, with 59 days credit.  Jail term may be served in a state institution.
WCS Day Report Center Program updating status
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: Hearing on May 22, 2015, Honorable Kathyryn W. Foster presiding.

The minutes in CCAP from the 5/22/15 sentencing hearing incorrectly stated the sentence as 30 days jail.  Judgment of Conviction to be amended to reflect the correct sentence of 4 months jail in this matter.  All other wording in the sentence to remain as previously written.  Also, the minutes in the file neglected to have the wording "Defendant to remain in custody until June 15, 2015.  At that time the remainder of the sentence is STAYED and defendant to be released to Day Report Center for compliance for 60 days."  This should be reflected on the amended Judgment of Conviction as well.

- 30 days jail CONSECUTIVE to 14CM1247; CONCURRENT with 14CF935.  Credit for 80 days to be applied first to 14CM1247.  Any remaining days of credit to be applied to sentence in 15CM358.  Defendant to remain in custody until June 15, 2015.  At that time the remainder of the sentence is STAYED and defendant to be released to Day Report Center for compliance for 60 days.
